dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hey B, so I was looking at some really interesting data about, uh, global gold reserves recently.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hey B, so I was looking at some really interesting data about, uh, global gold reserves recently.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah? What's the scoop? I mean, I always assume the US is, like, at the top, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah? What's the scoop? I mean, I always assume the U S is, like, at the top, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The United States which holds the highest reserves globally, added 92.23 tons, increasing its haul to 9,057.38 tons from 8,965.15 tons.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally, still number one. They actually *added* a huge amount, over 90 tons, bringing them to, like, nine thousand fifty-seven tons.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally, still number one. They actually added a huge amount, over ninety tons, bringing them to, like, nine thousand fifty-seven tons.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The United States which holds the highest reserves globally, added 92.23 tons, increasing its haul to 9,057.38 tons from 8,965.15 tons.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, that's a lot. But I heard some countries are actually, you know, *selling* off their gold, which is kind of surprising.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, that's a lot. But I heard some countries are actually, you know, selling off their gold, which is kind of surprising.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Germany is second with 3,703.74 tons of Gold, having liquidated 5.4 tons from March's 3,709.14 tons.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's the kicker! Germany, for example, they liquidated about five point four tons. And even the IMF, uh, sold off a bit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's the kicker! Germany, for example, they liquidated about five point four tons. And even the I M F, uh, sold off a bit.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Germany is second with 3,703.74 tons of Gold, having liquidated 5.4 tons from March's 3,709.14 tons. The International Monetary Fund holds 3,100.38 tons in gold reserves, while back in March, the figure stood at 3,101.53 tons. The institution has liquidated a total of 1.1 tons of the precious metal.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And Italy and France too, right? I saw they each trimmed, like, point seven-six tons from their holdings.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Italy and France too, right? I saw they each trimmed, like, point seven six tons from their holdings.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Italy is fourth with 2,701.63 tons, having liquidated 0.76 tons from March's 2,702.39 tons. As of December 2020, France had the fifth-highest gold reserves at 2,684.22 tons, after liquidating 0.76 tons from the 2,684.98 tons held in March.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. So it's not all one-way traffic. But then you have countries, like Russia, they actually *increased* their reserves pretty significantly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. So it's not all one-way traffic. But then you have countries, like Russia, they actually increased their reserves pretty significantly.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Russia holds 2,569.72 tons in gold reserves, an addition of 65.51 tons on the 2,504.21 tons held in March.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah, Russia added, like, sixty-five tons. And China too, they upped theirs by over thirty-six tons.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah, Russia added, like, sixty-five tons. And China too, they upped theirs by over thirty-six tons.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Russia holds 2,569.72 tons in gold reserves, an addition of 65.51 tons on the 2,504.21 tons held in March. China has upped its reserves by 36.75 tons to 2,196.55 tons as of December 2020.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And India gained some, which is interesting. Netherlands, though, actually sold a bit, I think, like over a ton.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And India gained some, which is interesting. Netherlands, though, actually sold a bit, I think, like over a ton.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: India has gained 13.85 tons in Gold to put its current figure at 699.88 tons. Netherlands gold reserves currently stand at 673.64 tons, having liquated 1.14 trillion from the original haul of 674.78 tons from March.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it seems like a lot of the European countries, uh, and the EU itself, were actually shedding some gold.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it seems like a lot of the European countries, uh, and the E U itself, were actually shedding some gold.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Germany is second with 3,703.74 tons of Gold, having liquidated 5.4 tons... Italy is fourth with 2,701.63 tons, having liquidated 0.76 tons... France had the fifth-highest gold reserves... after liquidating 0.76 tons... Switzerland has liquidated about 0.83 tons... Netherlands gold reserves currently stand at 673.64 tons... The European Union liquidated 1.22 tons in Gold, reducing its reserve to 554.82 tons.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, it makes you wonder, like, what's behind this mixed trend? Some selling, some buying big?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, it makes you wonder, like, what's behind this mixed trend? Some selling, some buying big?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, the article mentioned the pandemic. Remember all that money central banks were, you know, printing to stimulate the economy?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the article mentioned the pandemic. Remember all that money central banks were, you know, printing to stimulate the economy?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: When the pandemic hit, most countries began a new dash towards Gold. The dash came in the backdrop of central banks printing massive amounts of money to stimulate the global economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Ah, right! So, a 'dash towards gold' because of, um, potential inflation. Gold's seen as an intrinsic value, a hedge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ah, right! So, a dash towards gold because of, um, potential inflation. Gold's seen as an intrinsic value, a hedge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Notably, Gold continues to have an intrinsic value reassuring countries of good returns in case of heightened inflation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And some countries, like Japan and Switzerland, also reduced their holdings, so it's a real mixed bag out there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And some countries, like Japan and Switzerland, also reduced their holdings, so it's a real mixed bag out there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Switzerland has liquidated about 0.83 tons to record 1,145.29 tons as of December. Japan currently sits on 841.46 tons in gold reserves after liquidating 1.52 tons.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's fascinating how different nations react to, uh, global economic pressures, like, at the same time.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's fascinating how different nations react to, uh, global economic pressures, like, at the same time.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. Always something to keep an eye on.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. Always something to keep an eye on.
